DocsToKG Documentation

Welcome to the DocsToKG documentation! DocsToKG is a comprehensive system for transforming documents into knowledge graphs using vector search, machine learning, and AI technologies.

Overview

DocsToKG transforms documents into structured knowledge graphs that enable intelligent search, analysis, and discovery. Built on vector search technology (Faiss) and modern AI/ML frameworks, it provides:

  • Document Processing: Extract and structure content from various document formats

  • Knowledge Graph Construction: Build interconnected representations of document content

  • Intelligent Search: Semantic search capabilities across document collections

  • API-First Design: RESTful APIs for integration with other systems

Key Features

  • Multi-format Support: Process PDF, DOCX, TXT, HTML, and other document types

  • Scalable Architecture: Handle large document collections efficiently

  • AI-Powered: Leverage modern language models for content understanding

  • Extensible Design: Plugin architecture for custom processing pipelines

Getting Started

New to DocsToKG? Follow these steps:

  1. Learn the Basics: Read the ../../../01-overview/index to understand the system

  2. Set Up Environment: Follow the ../../../02-setup/index guide

  3. Explore Architecture: Understand components in ../../../03-architecture/index

  4. Use the APIs: Check ../../../04-api/index for integration options

  5. Contribute: See ../../../05-development/index for development guidelines

Quick Start Commands

# Clone the repository
git clone https://github.com/yourorg/docstokg.git
cd docstokg

# Set up development environment
python -m venv venv
source venv/bin/activate  # On Windows: venv\Scripts\activate
pip install -r requirements.txt

# Run tests
pytest tests/

For detailed setup instructions, see the ../../../02-setup/index.

Documentation Structure

This documentation follows a structured approach:

  • 01-overview/: High-level project introduction and concepts

  • 02-setup/: Installation and configuration guides

  • 03-architecture/: System design and component details

  • 04-api/: Complete API reference and examples

  • 05-development/: Contributing guidelines and development workflow

  • 06-operations/: Deployment and operational procedures

  • 07-reference/: Technical references and external integrations

Each section builds on the previous ones, providing progressive levels of detail.

  • Found a bug? Report it

  • Have a question? Start a discussion

  • Want to contribute? See our ../../../05-development/index
